messages.content: You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She went to the market to buy some vegetables
Her go to di market fi buy some vegetable.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: John and I are going to the beach later.
Me and John a go beach later.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: That book is mine.
That book a fi mi.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: My brother is coming later.
Me brother a come later.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Our teacher is very kind.
We teacher real kind.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Your phone is ringing.
You phone a ring.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Your shoes are outside.
Unu shoes deh outside.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: His father is a farmer.
Him father a farmer.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Their children go to that school.
Dem pickney go a dat school.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: You all need to finish your work.
Unu need fi finish unu work.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: It is getting dark now.
Getting dark now.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The children are playing outside.
The childrens a play outside.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The boys are playing football.
Di boy dem a play football.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: John and his friends are coming to the party.
John and dem a come to di party.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I need some advice before making a decision.
Mi need some advices before mi mek di decision.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The boys are playing in the yard.
Di boy a play inna di yard.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The dogs are barking loudly.
Di dog a bark loud.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She wants to buy a new car.
She want fi buy di new car.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The sun is very hot today.
A sun hot today.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The teacher is in the classroom.
Teacher deh inna classroom.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I saw a bird on the tree.
Mi see bird pon di tree.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She goes to school every day.
She go to di school every day.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She became president last year.
She turn a president last year.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: A man knocked on the door.
Wan man knock pon di door.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The girl is singing a song.
Dat girl a sing one song.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Those shoes are too expensive.
Them shoes too expensive.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I don’t like that dress.
Mi nuh like dat deh dress.

Convert to Jamaican English: This is John’s book.
Dis a John book.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I know the answer.
Mi knowing di answer.

Convert to Jamaican English: She always goes to church on Sundays.
She always going a church pon Sunday dem.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I have just eaten dinner.
Mi just eat dinner.

Convert to Jamaican English: She went to the market yesterday.
She have gone to the market yesterday.

I live in Kingston for ten years.

Convert to Jamaican English: She has finished her homework.
She done finish her homework.

Convert to Jamaican English: I had told you that already.
Mi been tell yuh dat already.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She said that he was sick.
She seh him sick.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I am going to tell her tomorrow.
Mi a go tell har tomorrow.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.

Mi waan help yuh wid yuh homework later.

Convert to Jamaican English: I will buy a house next year.
Mi woulda buy one house next year.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: If she had more time, she would help us.
If she woulda have more time, she woulda help we.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She kept crying even after the movie ended.
She stay deh cry even after di movie done.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Could you please lend me your pen?
You woulda gimme your pen, please?

She done eated already.

Him done go to di store already.

Him done went to di market already.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Yesterday, she ate all the mangoes.
Yesterday, she eaten all di mango dem.

Convert to Jamaican English: Yesterday, he walked to the shop.
Yesterday, him walk go shop.

Convert to Jamaican English: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
If me was rich, me would travel di world.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She took the money and told him the truth.
She go take the money and tell him di truth.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She brought the book and gave it to me.
She come bring di book and give it to me.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.

Him go take carry basket go market.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I didn’t see anything.
Mi neva see nothing.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She doesn’t like spicy food.
She don’t like spicy food.

Convert to Jamaican English: I don’t know where he went.
Me no know where him go.

She walk to school every day.

There is many people waiting outside.

Convert to Jamaican English: The children are in the yard.
The children inna di yard.

Convert to Jamaican English: She has finished her homework.
She done finish her homework.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: My brother, who lives in London, is coming to visit.
My brother, what live in London, a come fi visit.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: The girl who won the race is my cousin.
Di girl win di race a mi cousin.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She told me that she is tired.
She tell me say she tired.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: It is important that you understand the rules.
It important for you understand di rules.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She started singing when she was five.
She start sing when she was five.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I was waiting for you outside the shop.
Mi did wait you outside di shop.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: She sings really well.
She sing real good.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: He answered the question correctly.
Him answer the question correct.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: It was yesterday that she left.
A yesterday she leave.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I don't like that kind of food at all.
That kind of food, mi nuh like at all.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: It’s John who ate the cake.
A John eat di cake.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: I asked what he was doing.
Mi ask what was him doing.
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: What are you doing?
What you doing?
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: Did you see him yesterday?
You see him yesterday?
You are a translator from Standard American English to Jamaican English.
Convert to Jamaican English: And I was like, 'Are you serious right now?'
Mi deh deh like, 'Yuh serious fi true?'
